main event: A pilot observed an unidentified flying object resembling a jet-propelled aircraft while flying near Sandberg Pass on February 23, 1949.
interesting points: The object made a complete 360° turn around the pilot's aircraft and then a 180° turn, both observed in approximately 20 seconds,The object was described as having a sausage shape, with forward and trailing ends resembling a B-29 nose,Visibility was reported to be 10 miles with scattered clouds at 20,000 feet,The object left a steady glow presumed to be jet exhaust,The investigation found no other witnesses to corroborate the sighting.
sighted object: unidentified flying object resembling a jet-propelled aircraft
witness description: 1st Lt., Air Force Reserve Pilot, stationed with Fresno State Teachers College, described as an earnest young man with a good reputation.
